DataElement.preferredName: Stress Echocardiogram Heart Wall Motion Abnormality Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding the presence of unusual physical characteristics of the movement (change in position) of the layer of tissue that encloses the heart observed during a stress echocardiogram.  This unusual characteristic may be suggestive of ischemia.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stress Echocardiogram Heart Wall Motion Abnormality
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus._A test that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart._A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur._A layer of material that encloses space or that encloses a structure._The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part._A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus.:A procedure that uses ultrasonic waves directed over the chest wall to obtain a graphic record of the heart's position, motion of the walls, or internal parts such as the valves.

Concepts.definition: The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.
A procedure that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to create an image of the heart.

Property.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.:A layer of material that encloses space or that encloses a structure.:The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.:A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).
A layer of material that encloses space or that encloses a structure.
The act or process of changing position or place; the change in position of a body part.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
